author: R Sivaraman
text:
Consecration held in 25 temples in Puducherry

Government has declared holiday to all schools, colleges and government departments on Wednesday in view of consecration ceremonies at over big and small 25 temples in Puducherry.

Chief Minister N.Rangasamy on Tuesday announced that a holiday was declared in view of the festivals to be held at these temples.

The ancient Thirukameeshwarar- Kohilambigai temple in Villianur, Ganga Nathiswarar in Thirukanchi, Sri Varadharaja Perumal temple are the notable among the 25. Renovation works of shrines and gopurams are completed at the ancient Thirukameeshwarar- Kohilambigai temple in Villianur which is one of the largest and important temples in the Union Territory that had been accorded a special place during the years of French rule.

The more than 1000-year-old Chola period temple is bracing up for the Mahakumbabishekam celebrations on Wednesday. The renovation works commenced in December 2012 at an estimated cost of Rs.11.55 crore.

Similarly the consecration of Sri Perundevi Thayar Samedha Sri Varadharaja Perumal temple will be held on Wednesday The renovation works had commenced three years ago at an estimated cost of Rs.5 crore. The Dravidian style ancient temple is located in Puducherry and is believed to be the one of the oldest temples in the Union Territory. The temple is under the purview of Hindu Religious Department.
title: Holiday for schools, colleges, for consecration of temples
